de.esoco.lib.model

Class AbstractDataProvider<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.esoco.lib.model.AbstractDataProvider<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    DataProvider<T>, HasAttributeFilter<T>, HasAttributeSorting<T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ListDataProvider

    public abstract class AbstractDataProvider<T>
extends java.lang.Object
implements DataProvider<T>, HasAttributeFilter<T>, HasAttributeSorting<T>
    A base class for DataProvider implementations that handles the management of filter and sort constraints.

        Sets or removes a filter for a certain attribute and then applies the resulting filter to this instance.
        Specified by:
        applyFilter in interface HasAttributeFilter<T>
        Parameters:
        rAttribute - The binding describing the attribute
        pCriteria - A predicate containing the filter criteria or NULL to remove a filter

      • applySorting

        public <V extends java.lang.Comparable<V>> void applySorting(java.util.function.Function<? super T,V> rAttribute,
                                                             SortDirection eDirection)
        Sets or removes the sorting of a certain attribute and then applies it to this instance. The order in which sortings are applied defines their precedence, with the first sorting having the highest.
        Specified by:
        applySorting in interface HasAttributeSorting<T>
        Parameters:
        rAttribute - The binding describing the attribute
        eDirection - The sort direction or NULL to remove sorting

      • getFilter

        public <V> java.util.function.Predicate<? super V> getFilter(java.util.function.Function<? super T,V> rAttribute)
        Returns the filter for a particular attribute. If no filter has been set for the given attribute NULL will be returned.
        Specified by:
        getFilter in interface HasAttributeFilter<T>
        Parameters:
        rAttribute - The attribute to query the filter predicate for
        Returns:
        The attribute filter predicate or NULL for none

      • getSortDirection

        public SortDirection getSortDirection(java.util.function.Function<? super T,?> rAttribute)
        Returns the sort direction for a particular attribute. If no sorting has been set for the given attribute NULL will be returned.
        Specified by:

        Parameters:
